snippet: The department also did not disclose until recently the fictitious identities it created for terrorism-linked witnesses to the agency that generates watch lists, a new report said.
abstract: Report by internal watchdog says Justice Dept temporarily lost track of two former terrorists who had participated in its witness protection program; says until recently it did not disclose fictitious identities it created for terrorism-linked witnesses to agency that generates watch lists, allowing some who were on no-fly list to take commercial flights under their new names.
lead_paragraph: The department also did not disclose until recently the fictitious identities it created for terrorism-linked witnesses to the agency that generates watch lists, a new report said.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Lost Track of Terrorists, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Lost Track Of Terrorists, Report Says
